arts.ttl: Leicester City 1-0 Bournemouth live reaction as Cooper earns first Premier League win
arts.sum: First half, we had some really good attacking moves, got players in position from the model of play we’re trying to develop and feel can hurt opponents. When we got that right in the first half, I felt that’s what we did.

arts.ttl: Leicester must be completely obsessed with beating Southampton – Steve Cooper
arts.sum: Cooper wants the Foxes to build on a first win of the season when the Premier League resumes after the international break.

arts.ttl: Iraola left frustrated by Cherries' missed chances in defeat to Leicester
arts.sum: Andoni Iraola was left frustrated by Cherries' missed chances as they failed to score against Leicester City and left the King Power Stadium empty handed.

arts.ttl: Leicester City player ratings v Bournemouth as Buonanotte dazzles and Faes colossal in vital win - Jordan Blackwell - Leicestershire Live
arts.sum: Bournemouth slowly found their feet and City needed Wout Faes to block a couple of efforts, but the Cherries’ advances left more space, and City exploited it with an excellent back-to-front move, Buonanotte slipping in Jamie Vardy. For the first time in his City career, Harry Winks was dropped to the bench for a league game, with Wilfred Ndidi dropping deep and Jordan Ayew coming into the attack.

arts.ttl: Facundo Buonanotte earns Leicester a first win of the season
arts.sum: Bournemouth thought they had equalised but Evanilson was offside.

arts.ttl: Leicester City team news v Bournemouth as Harry Winks surprisingly misses out
arts.sum: City (4-2-3-1): Hermansen; Justin, Faes, Okoli, Kristiansen; Ndidi, Skipp; Ayew, Buonanotte, Mavididi; Vardy. Winks started 45 of City’s 46 Championship matches last term, only missing the home win over Watford through suspension, and had played every Premier League minute so far this season.

arts.ttl: 'Relief' for Evanilson after first Cherries goal against Southampton
arts.sum: There was relief for striker Evanilson when he opened his Cherries goalscoring account against Southampton.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth boss sends William Saliba warning to his centre-backs ahead of Leicester City clash
arts.sum: I hope our centre-backs are ready because we know it’s not going to be comfortable for them.” Although City are yet to win, Iraola was quick to point out that, across their six fixtures, they’ve not yet been handsomely beaten and been well in contention going into the latter stages of every game.

arts.ttl: Foxes Q&A live on winless run, team selection, Cooper future, relegation battle
arts.sum: It’s six games without a victory for Leicester City, and while they remain outside of the relegation zone for now, the need for three points is growing. With the next four fixtures all offering excellent opportunities to claim three points, it will be interesting to see the team that Cooper opts for against the Cherries.

arts.ttl: Steve Cooper pressure growing as pundits weigh in on Leicester City's 'must-win' Bournemouth clash
arts.sum: Whilst he maintains the opinion that City will finish higher than fellow newly-promoted teams Ipswich Town, currently two places above Cooper's men in 15th, and Southampton, currently 19th, he foresees a 1-1 draw with Bournemouth this weekend, so no win before the break. Leicester City have one final opportunity before the next international break to register their first Premier League win under Steve Cooper, with Bournemouth their next visitors.
